vnsMParam.description: Security-level range from 0-100, ASA default to 0 if not set
Must be of the form x:x:x:x::x/prefix
Specifies the use of the interface ID in the low order 64 bits of the IPv6 address
The link-local address is composed of the link-local prefix FE80::/64 and the interface ID in modified EUI-64 format.
Enables stateless autoconfiguration on the interface, value is enable
To enable IPv6 processing, value is enable

vnsMFolder.description: To configure which IPv6 prefixes are included in IPv6 router advertisements. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192

vnsMParam.description: The IPv6 network number to include in router advertisements. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
The amount of time that the specified IPv6 prefix is advertised as being valid. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
The amount of time (in seconds) that the specified IPv6 prefix is advertised as being preferred. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
The date at which the lifetime expire. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
The date at which the prefered expire. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
Indicates that the specified prefix is not used for on-link determination, valid value is enable. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192

Indicates to hosts on the local link that the specified prefix cannot be used for IPv6 autoconfiguration, valid value is enable. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192

Indicates to hosts on the local link that the specified prefix cannot be used for IPv6 autoconfiguration, valid value is enable. Please see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/i4.html#wp1917192
Number of consecutive neighbor solicitation messages, range from 0-600, default is 1
Interval between IPv6 neighbor solicitation retransmissions, range from 1000-3600000 ms, default is 1000
Amount of time that a remote IPv6 node is considered reachable, range from 0-3600000 ms, default is 0
Interval between IPv6 router advertisement transmissions, range from 500 to 1800000 ms, default is 200000
Router lifetime value in IPv6 router advertisements, range from 0-9000 seconds, default is 1800

vnsMParam.description: Port-channel ID, range from 1-48
Member interface, for example, GigabitEthernet0/1

vnsMFolder.description: Specify an access list to be used globally

vnsMRel.description: The name of the access list

vnsMFolder.description: Configure a list of access control entries

vnsMParam.description: Specify 'permit' to forward packets, or 'deny' to reject packets

vnsMFolder.description: Specify the destination address. It can be either a network object name, or a network object group name. If not specified, the default is any destination address.

vnsMParam.description: Specify 'any', 'any4', or 'any6' for both IPv4 and IPv6, only IPv4, or only IPv6 addresses respectively. The default is 'any'.
Specify a network object name
Specify a network object group name.

vnsMFolder.description: For a protocol of TCP or UDP, specifies the destination service information

vnsMParam.description: Specify the operator. It can be 'lt', 'gt', 'eq', 'neq', or 'range'.
Port number. For a range, this is the first port of the range.
Port number used for a range. This is the last port of the range.

vnsMFolder.description: For a protocol of ICMP or ICMP6, specifies the ICMP information

vnsMParam.description: Specify the ICMP type by name or number.
Specify the ICMP code.
A number to specify the order of the access control entry within the access list

vnsMFolder.description: Specify the protocol. It can be either an IP protocol name or number, a service object name, or a service object group name. If not specified, the default is 'ip'.

vnsMParam.description: Specify an IP protocol name or number. Specify 'ip' to apply to all protocols.
Specify a service object name
Specify a service object group name.

vnsMFolder.description: Specify the source address. It can be either a network object name, or a network object group name. If not specified, the default is any source address.

vnsMParam.description: Specify 'any', 'any4', or 'any6' for both IPv4 and IPv6, only IPv4, or only IPv6 addresses respectively. The default is 'any'.
Specify a network object name
Specify a network object group name.

vnsMFolder.description: For a protocol of TCP or UDP, specifies the source service information

vnsMParam.description: Specify the operator. It can be 'lt', 'gt', 'eq', 'neq', or 'range'.
Port number. For a range, this is the first port of the range.
Port number used for a range. This is the last port of the range.
Specify this parameter (the value is ignored) to clear dynamic translations when deploying access lists.
Enable logging to all output supported destinations, valid input is 'enable'
Enable logging on standby unit with failover enabled, valid input is 'enable'
Set logging buffered level, value could be 0-7, or emergencies, alerts, critical, errors, warnings, notifications, informational, or debugging
Specify logging buffer size in bytes, valid range is a number between 4096 and 1048576
Save logging buffer to flash when buffer wrap-around, valid input is 'enable'
Specify logging maximum flash space allocation, valid range is a number between 4 and 61558
Specify logging minimum flash free space threshold, valid range is a number between 0 and 61558
Set logging level for syslog server, value could be 0-7, or emergencies, alerts, critical, errors, warnings, notifications, informational, or debugging
Allow new connection even if TCP syslog server is down, valid input is 'enable'
Specify the syslog facility, valid range is a number between 16 and 23

vnsMFolder.description: Send syslog messages to a host

vnsMParam.description: Specify the interface
Specify the IP address or name of the syslog server
Enter 'protocol/port', The protocol over which the syslog message is sent, could be TCP or UDP. The allowable range for ports is 1025 through 65535. The default is port 514 for UDP and 1470 for TCP
Establish secure TLS/SSL connection with TLS/SSL capable Syslog Server, valid input is 'enable'
Enable EMBLEM format logging, available only for udp syslog messages, valid input is 'enable'

vnsMFolder.description: Specify a message to be allowed

vnsMParam.description: Specify a message number, valid range is a number between 100000 and 999999
Value could be 0-7, or emergencies, alerts, critical, errors, warnings, notifications, informational, or debugging
Enable or disable failover
Set the failover device to 'primary' or 'secondary'
Configure the failover shared secret
Configure the failover shared secret or key in hex, value is 32-character key in hexadecimal format
Set the policy for failover due to interface failures, valid input could be [1-100] or [1-100]%
Enable or disable HTTP (port 80) connection replication, valid input is 'enable'

vnsMFolder.description: The LAN based failover connection between the two failover devices

vnsMParam.description: The interface name of the failover connection

vnsMFolder.description: The link(stateful) failover connection between the two failover devices

vnsMParam.description: The interface name of the failover connection

vnsMFolder.description: Configure the IP address to be used for failover and/or stateful update information

vnsMParam.description: The interface name of the failover connection
The IP of the failover connection for the active failover unit
The netmask of the failover connection
The IP of the failover connection for the standby failover unit

vnsMFolder.description: Configure the standby IP address for management interface

vnsMParam.description: The IP of the management interface on active failover unit
The netmask on the interface
The IP of the management interface on the standby failover unit
Configure failover poll time for the failover unit or interface, default is unit
Poll interval in seconds, valid range is a number between 1 and 15. Mutually exclusive with interval_in_msec.
Specify poll interval in miliseconds, valid range is a number between 200 and 999. Mutually exclusive with interval_in_second.
Hold time in second, valid range is a number between 1 and 45. Mutually exclusive with holdtime_in_msec.
Hold time in millisecond, valid range is a number between 800 and 999. Mutually exclusive with holdtime_in_second.
Specify if this device will be the first one to join the cluster and be the master. Valid input is 'master' or 'slave'

vnsMFolder.description: Define cluster pool for the management interface

vnsMParam.description: The name of the cluster pool
The first IP in the cluster pool
The last(end) IP in the cluster pool
The netmask of the subnet that IP addresses belong to
Specify the name for the whole cluster, it is a string less than 39 charactors. Passing an empty string will delete the cluster group.
Configure cluster connection re-balance frequency, valid range is a number between 1 and 360
Tunnel slave's console output to master, valid input is 'enable'
Configure cluster health monitoring holdtime in seconds, when it timed out the corresponding unit is declared down. The valid range is between 0.8 and 45
Specify the secret used to authenticate units in a cluster, the value is an alphanumeric string up to 128 characters
Specify the local unit name for the master, it is a string less than 39 characters
Specify priority level to a cluster unit for master election, valid range is a number between 1 and 100. The higher the number, the lower the priority.

vnsMFolder.description: Configure Cluster LACP(CLACP) parameters for span-cluster port-channels

vnsMParam.description: MAC address in the form of H.H.H (where H is 1 to 4 digit of hex number), or use the keyword 'auto' (without quotes) to indicate automatic generate MAC address
Configure Cluster LACP system-priority for span-cluster port-channels, valid range is a number between 1 and 65535
Specify the cluster control link IP
Specify the netmask of the cluster control link
Specify if a device should be enabled in a cluster. Input 'enable' when setting up cluster, including both master and slaves.
Specify the MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) on the clustering interface (also known as CCL). Valid range is a number between 64 and 65535.
Advanced threat detection statistics; value is enabled or disable
Advanced threat detection statistics access-list; value is enable or disable
Enable TCP intercept; value is enable or disable

Advanced threat detection TCP intercept rate interval value. Range is 1 to 1440 minutes. The default is 30 minutes. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523

Advanced threat detection TCP intercept average rate value. Range is 25 and 2147483647. The default is 200 per second. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523

Advanced threat detection TCP intercept burst rate value. Range is 25 to 2147483647. The default is 400 per second. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Enable rate option; value is enable or disable
Advanced threat detection statistics number of rate (value is 1, 2, or 3). For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Enable rate option; value is enable or disable
Advanced threat detection statistics number of rate (value is 1, 2, or 3). For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Enable rate option; value is enable or disable
Advanced threat detection statistics number of rate (value is 1, 2, or 3). For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Scanning threat detection; value is enable or disable
Enable shun option; value is enable or disable
Enable rate option; value is enable or disable
Scanning threat rate interval. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Scanning threat burst rate. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Scanning threat average rate. For details see http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/command-reference/t1.html#wp1563523
Enable shun duration option; value is enable or disable
Scanning threat shun duration; value range is 10 to 2592000 seconds, default is 3600.
Enable shun except option; value is enable or disable
Scanning threat shun except IP address
Scanning threat shun except IP mask
Enable shun except object-group option; value is enable or disable
Scanning threat shun except object group name
The action can be any or all of the following: alarm, drop, reset
The action can be any or all of the following: alarm, drop, reset
NTP server hostname or ip address
Configure peer authentication key number
Prefer this peer when possible; value is enable
Provides a key ID for the adaptive security appliance to use in packets for authentication with an NTP server.
Enables NTP authentication. No default value or behavior.

vnsMFolder.description: Sets an encrypted authentication key to synchronize with an NTP server.

vnsMParam.description: Authentication key number
Authentication key value, which is a string that can be up to 32 characters long

vnsMFolder.description: Configure a DNS server to access external serves by domain name.

vnsMParam.description: Sets the default domain name globally, up to 63 characters.
Configure the DNS server addresses to which you want to send DNS requests, up to 6 entries.

vnsMFolder.description: Configure Anonymous Reporting, a subfeature of the Smart Call Home feature. See details at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa91/configuration/general/monitor_smart_call_home.html

vnsMParam.description: Specify this parameter (the value is ignored), valid input is 'enable'.

vnsMFolder.description: Template and collector parameters. See details at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa84/configuration/guide/monitor_nsel.html

vnsMParam.description: Template timeout rate, in minutes. Default value is 30. Range is 1 to 3600 minutes.
Delay sending flow-create event, in seconds. Default value is 0. Value is 1 to 180 seconds.
Active refresh interval, in minutes. Default value is 1. Range is 1 to 60 minutes.
Status of collector, value is enable or disable
Collector host IP
Collector port number
Idle time after which a TCP connection state will be closed, default is 01:00:00. Range is 0:5:0 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which a TCP half-closed connection will be freed, default is 00:10:00. Range is 0:0:30 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which general UDP states will be closed, default is 0:02:00. This timer does not apply to DNS or SUNRPC. Range is 0:1:0 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle timeout for ICMP, default is 0:00:02. Range is 0:0:2 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which an H.323 control connection will be closed, default is 0:05:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which an H.225 signaling connection will be closed, default is 1:00:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which an MGCP media connection will be closed, default is 0:05:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which an MGCP PAT Xlate will be removed, default is 0:05:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which buffered packets waiting for reassembly in tcp-proxy are dropped, default is 0:01:00. Range is 0:0:10 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which connections using the backup route will be closed once lower metric route becomes available, default is 0:0:0. Range is 0:0:30 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which a SUNRPC slot will be closed, default is 00:10:00. Range is 0:1:0 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which a SIP control connection will be closed, default is 0:30:00. Range is 0:5:0 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which a SIP Media connection will be closed, default is 0:02:00. Range is 0:1:0 to 1193:0:0. 0:0:0 means never timeout.
Idle time after which a SIP Provisional Media connection will be closed, default is 0:2:0. Range is 0:1:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which pinholes for PROVISIONAL responsesand media xlates will be closed, default is 0:1:0. Range is 0:0:30 to 1193:0:0.
Idle timeout after which SIP session is deleted if 200 OK is not received for a CANCEL or BYE message, default s 0:2:0. Range is 0:0:1 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which a dynamic address will be returned to the free pool, default is 3:00:00.Range is 0:1:0 to 1193:0:0.
Idle time after which a dynamic port will be returned to the free PAT pool, default is 0:00:30. Range is 0:0:30 to 0:5:0.

Idle time after which an authentication will no longer be cached and the user will need to re-authenticate on their connection, default is 0:05:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0. Run the timer continuously.

Idle time after which an authentication will no longer be cached and the user will need to re-authenticate on their connection, default is 0:05:00. Range is 0:0:0 to 1193:0:0. Re-start the timer after a connection becomes idle.

vnsMFolder.description: Global configuration for NetFLow reporting and connection limits, application inspection, and NetFflow report

vnsMParam.description: Global Service Policy enable state. Value: enable or disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Configure global connection limits. See details at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa91/configuration/firewall/conns_connlimits.html

vnsMParam.description: Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Enable or disable TCP sequence number randomization, value is enable or disable. Default is enable.
Set the timeout period until a TCP embryonic connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:5 and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:0:30. 0 means the which means the connection never times out.
Set the idle timeout period until a half-closed connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:5:0(fpr 9.1.(1) and earlier) or 0:0:30(for 9.1(2) and later) and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:10:0.
Set the idle time out period after which an established connection of any protocol closes, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 1193:0:0. The default is 1:0:0. 0 means the connection never times out.
It's for TCP taffic, the reset keyword sends a reset to TCP endpoints when the connection timesout. Default is disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Connection timeout DCD setting. You configure DCD when you want idle, but valid hosts to determine the validity of the connections.

vnsMParam.description: Sets the retry-interval duration to wait after each unresponsive DCD probe before sending out another probe, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 24:0:0. The default is 0:0:15.
Sets the number of consecutive failed retries for DCD before declaring the connection as dead, between 1 and 255. Default is 5.
should contain default-inspection-traffic
dcerpc inspection, value is enable or disable
dns inspection, value is enable or disable
dns preset map inspection, value is enable or disable
esmtp inspection, value is enable or disable
ftp inspection, value is enable or disable
ftp_strict inspection, value is enable or disable
gtp inspection, value is enable or disable
h323 h225 inspection, value is enable or disable
h323 ras inspection, value is enable or disable
http inspection, value is enable or disable
icmp inspection, value is enable or disable
icmp error inspection, value is enable or disable
ils inspection, value is enable or disable
ip-options inspection, value is enable or disable
mgcp inspection, value is enable or disable
netbios inspection, value is enable or disable
pptp inspection, value is enable or disable
rsh inspection, value is enable or disable
rtsp inspection, value is enable or disable
sip inspection, value is enable or disable
skinny inspection, value is enable or disable
snmp inspection, value is enable or disable
sqlnet inspection, value is enable or disable
sunrpc inspection, value is enable or disable
tftp inspection, value is enable or disable
waas inspection, value is enable or disable
xdmcp inspection, value is enable or disable
Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
Enable all event export to destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Enable flow creation event export destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Enable flow deny event export destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.

value must be either fail-open or fail-close
optional sensor name

Member interface, for example, 10.10.10.10/255.255.255.255
Must be of the form x:x:x:x::x/prefix
To enable IPv6 processing, value is enable
Number of consecutive neighbor solicitation messages, range from 0-600, default is 1
Interval between IPv6 neighbor solicitation retransmissions, range from 1000-3600000 ms, default is 1000
Amount of time that a remote IPv6 node is considered reachable, range from 0-3600000 ms, default is 0

vnsMFolder.description: IPv6 enforce eui64 for internal interface

vnsMFolder.description: IPv6 enforce eui64 for external interface

vnsMParam.description: Global command to enforce eui64 of this interface, value is enable

vnsMParam.description: The foreign network for this route, could be a hostname or in A.B.C.D form
The netmask for the destined foreign network
The address of the gateway by which the foreign network is reached
Distance metric for this route, valid range is a number between 1 and 255, inclusive.
The IPv6 prefix, in the form of X:X:X:X::X/[0-128]
IPv6 name or address
Maximum hop count for this route, valid range is a number between 1 and 255, inclusive.
Enable the default tunnel gateway option, metric is set to 255. valid input is 'tunneled'.
The foreign network for this route, could be a hostname or in A.B.C.D form
The netmask for the destined foreign network
The address of the gateway by which the foreign network is reached
Distance metric for this route, valid range is a number between 1 and 255, inclusive.
The IPv6 prefix, in the form of X:X:X:X::X/[0-128]
IPv6 name or address
Maximum hop count for this route, valid range is a number between 1 and 255, inclusive.
Enable the default tunnel gateway option, metric is set to 255. valid input is 'tunneled'.
Specify a network object name or network object group name for the mapped address.
Specify a network object name or network object group name for the real address.
Specify this parameter (the value is ignored) to translate DNS replies.
A number to specify the order of the NAT rule.
Specify a service object name for the source mapped port and destination real port.
Specify a service object name for the source real port and destination mapped port.
Specify a network object name or network object group name for the mapped address.
Specify the NAT type of either 'static' or 'dynamic'.
Specify a network object name or network object group name for the real address.

Specify this parameter (the value is ignored), for static NAT, to make the translation unidirection from the source to the destination; the destination addresses cannot initiate traffic to the source addresses.
Specify this parameter (the value is ignored) to clear the translations for NAT rules that are changed.

vnsMFolder.description: Configuration for NetFLow reporting and connection limits, application inspection, and NetFflow report for internal connector

vnsMParam.description: Connector Service Policy enable state. Value: enable or disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Configure connector connection limits. See details at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa91/configuration/firewall/conns_connlimits.html

vnsMParam.description: Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Enable or disable TCP sequence number randomization, value is enable or disable. Default is enable.
Set the timeout period until a TCP embryonic connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:5 and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:0:30. 0 means the which means the connection never times out.
Set the idle timeout period until a half-closed connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:5:0(fpr 9.1.(1) and earlier) or 0:0:30(for 9.1(2) and later) and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:10:0.
Set the idle time out period after which an established connection of any protocol closes, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 1193:0:0. The default is 1:0:0. 0 means the connection never times out.
It's for TCP taffic, the reset keyword sends a reset to TCP endpoints when the connection timesout. Default is disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Connection timeout DCD setting. You configure DCD when you want idle, but valid hosts to determine the validity of the connections.

vnsMParam.description: Sets the retry-interval duration to wait after each unresponsive DCD probe before sending out another probe, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 24:0:0. The default is 0:0:15.
Sets the number of consecutive failed retries for DCD before declaring the connection as dead, between 1 and 255. Default is 5.
Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the settings, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
dcerpc inspection, value is enable or disable
dns inspection, value is enable or disable
dns preset map inspection, value is enable or disable
esmtp inspection, value is enable or disable
ftp inspection, value is enable or disable
ftp_strict inspection, value is enable or disable
gtp inspection, value is enable or disable
h323 h225 inspection, value is enable or disable
h323 ras inspection, value is enable or disable
http inspection, value is enable or disable
icmp inspection, value is enable or disable
icmp error inspection, value is enable or disable
ils inspection, value is enable or disable
ip-options inspection, value is enable or disable
mgcp inspection, value is enable or disable
netbios inspection, value is enable or disable
pptp inspection, value is enable or disable
rsh inspection, value is enable or disable
rtsp inspection, value is enable or disable
sip inspection, value is enable or disable
skinny inspection, value is enable or disable
snmp inspection, value is enable or disable
sqlnet inspection, value is enable or disable
sunrpc inspection, value is enable or disable
tftp inspection, value is enable or disable
waas inspection, value is enable or disable
xdmcp inspection, value is enable or disable

vnsMFolder.description: Configure NetFlow report control on internal connector.

vnsMParam.description: Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the settings, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
Enable all event export to destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Enable flow creation event export destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Enable flow deny event export destination collector. Value is 'enable' or 'disable
Event destination collector. Must be previously defined in the NetFlowObjects
Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.

vnsMFolder.description: Sets IPS mode and fail mode

vnsMParam.description: value must be either inline or promiscuous
value must be either fail-open or fail-close
optional sensor name

vnsMFolder.description: Configuration for NetFLow reporting and connection limits, application inspection, and NetFflow report for external connector

vnsMParam.description: Connector Service Policy enable state. Value: enable or disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Configure connector connection limits. See details at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa91/configuration/firewall/conns_connlimits.html

vnsMParam.description: Name of the access-list to match for traffic to apply the connection limits, or 'any'. Default 'any'.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of all simultaneous connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Set the maximum number of TCP embtryonic connections that are allowed per client machine, between 0 and 2000000. Default is 0 which means unlimited connections.
Enable or disable TCP sequence number randomization, value is enable or disable. Default is enable.
Set the timeout period until a TCP embryonic connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:5 and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:0:30. 0 means the which means the connection never times out.
Set the idle timeout period until a half-closed connection is closed, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:5:0(fpr 9.1.(1) and earlier) or 0:0:30(for 9.1(2) and later) and 1193:00:00. Default is 0:10:0.
Set the idle time out period after which an established connection of any protocol closes, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 1193:0:0. The default is 1:0:0. 0 means the connection never times out.
It's for TCP taffic, the reset keyword sends a reset to TCP endpoints when the connection timesout. Default is disable.

vnsMFolder.description: Connection timeout DCD setting. You configure DCD when you want idle, but valid hosts to determine the validity of the connections.

vnsMParam.description: Sets the retry-interval duration to wait after each unresponsive DCD probe before sending out another probe, in hh:mm:ss format between 0:0:1 and 24:0:0. The default is 0:0:15.
Sets the number of consecutive failed retries for DCD before declaring the connection as dead, between 1 and 255. Default is 5.
